text: Grunt fill from Albertsons. Bright golden pour, milky, fluffy head fades fast. Fruity, flowery aroma, mild dank notes. More funk and fruit in the taste, drying bitterness. Sweet and bitter.

It pours golden with a white head that has moderate head retention. It is fairly clear. There are aromas of rye, tropical fruit, and pineapple. There hops work very well with the rye to give it a unique rye and tropical flavor. In addition the flavors are highlighted by some citrus and grapefruit. It has a moderate body with a moderately high bitterness. The bitterness is high enough to provide a good bite, without being overpowering. Overall, this is an excellent ipa highlighted by the rye and tropical flavors with just enough bitterness for a good punch.

On draft. Ive heard that Nelson is a "divisive" hop, but this might be the first time Ive really noticed it. From the description, I was expecting tropical, grassy, and white wine notes, but I was blown away by how earthy, woody, and spicy it was. The rye malt definitely accentuated the peppery/woody notes from the Nelson. This is interesting and very unique, and Id definitely drink another pint of it, but it wasnt at all what I was expecting.
Draft at the Draft Shack. Golden pour, thin white head. Nose is grapefruit and tangerine. Bitter. Middle is soft malt, smooth rye, pithy citrus. Finish starts sweet orange, but finishes bitter hop.

On tap at Republic Seven Corners with commonshawn. Tulip style glass. Much brighter than what is expected from a rye IPA. Cloudiness reminiscent of New England type efforts. Nice white head about a quarter finger in size. Nose is bright and citrus. Taste leans away from the New England juicy style to bring a citrus forward and bitter IPA to the table. The rye asserts itself towards the end with a little bit of a spice characteristic. Lingering citrus rind bitterness but with an underlying knowing sweetness to help prevent ruining the drinking experience. A vibrant effort that only improves as it warms. Other rye IPAs tremble at the thought of going against Alpines full Nelson.

Hazy and quite pale. Fairly thick head. Has a mellow tart nose, with a berryish hop aroma. On the palate, sort of a harsh bitterness, woody and herbal...ok not the best balanced IPA. Theres a touch of malt sweetness but not enough to give me the balance I need.
On tap at the San Diego Brewers guild festival. Very strong Nelson sauvin aroma, grapes. Taste is dry and hoppy, citrusy. Dry hopiness mouthfeel, some hop spiceness in the end. Amazing beer

​
Pours hazy golden yellow with thick stickey white head. Smell is tropical
Fruit, citrus and hops. Taste is juicy citrus, hint of lime, pine and hops. Light body medium carb. Different but excellent.
Tap @ Villains Chicago. Dark hazy yellow amber brown, good head. Bitter citrus hop aroma. Dry mango grapefruit lime flavour. Very bitter aftertaste. Good IPA.
Another waylaid review. Grapefruit and tropicals, pine. And Ive come to the conclusion that rye is a great addition to just about anything.
On tap at Beer Run. Aromas of bubble gum, piney, floral, subtle tropical fruit. Hazy yellow with a fairly lasting white head. Dry, tropical, grassy, somewhat spicy. Medium bodied.

Draft at Green Flash Brewing Company, 7/2/2016. hazy pale straw with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, citrus, and grapefruit. Taste follows nose with some mild pine and hints of white wine noted at the finish.

On tap at Brunzies. Ozone, resin, pineapple, apricot. Dank and heady, with light sweet vapor. Cloudy golden-amber with creamy lacing off-white head. Medium body with a little heft and medium smooth carbonation. Strong hop taste with characteristic Nelson Sauvin profile. Moderate sweetness throughout, finishing with a burst of hop flavor and moderate bitterness. Light bitter after.

Draft to taster at cappys pour hazy light gold with thin white head. Nose floral, tropical fruit hop, sweeter flavors. Taste moderate bitter bite up front, then grassy, weedy, lemon hop. Taste a little disconnected from the nose. Moderate bitter through the finish.

Bottle in Seattle. Lovely wafting aroma. Solid funk, cheese, a little lemon. Some rye brashness. Bright white cream on cloudy yellow white body. Bright, kind of unusual appearance. Clean, full IPA. Sweet hops, Nelson, some grape must. Rye is in check and a nice compliment. Simply fantastic.
Nice spicy and piney aroma and flavors. Mildly sweet and relatively complex. The kind of beer that would be easy to drink quite a few. Light caramel color and a medium body. Not too filling.

Cloudy orange with no head. Huge grapefruit aroma. Smooth medium bodied and a dry finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is an absolutely amazing ipa. Theres a gigantic white wine characteristic from the Nelson Sauvin hops. Aroma is fruity, tropical and full of pungent hoppiness. Taste is again, white wine and tropical citrus juice. So many awesome flavors with a bone dry finish. I really loved this and highly recommend it. Cheers!
Man, this stuff tastes so good. Aroma is just right malt with true Nelson tart, fruity, but also a little resin. With these malts, super easy drinking. Slight chewy body. I want more!

Bottle. Light orange/deep yellow slightly cloudy pour with a thin off white head. Aroma of passion fruit, piney hops, soap, and light malt. Thin to medium body, very drinkable which can be somewhat dangerous given the ABV. Nice snappy finish.

Rich light copper coloured body with a thinnish tan head, about a centimetre tall. Aroma of pure new world hops with some passionfruit, orange zest, citrus, perfume and a bunch of light malt noticeable as well - fairly balanced. Medium-bodied; Strong assertive hops up front but not terribly bitter, but still packing the tropical fruit flavour, with some noticeable malt and earth showing as well near the end. Aftertaste shows some bitterness from the hops, but also a lot of perfume and some grass as well. Overall, a pretty well-balanced IPA, but nothing exceptional or really worth searching out - this was fine, but I was expecting a better West Coast IPA from this brewery. I sampled this 65 cL Green Flash-styled tall bottle purchased from Costco in Arlington (Pentagon City), Virginia on 17-January-2016 for US$7,69 sampled at home in Washington after just returning from Europe a few minutes earlier on 27-March-2016. Best By Date on Bottle: 21-March-2016

Bottle hauled back from California by Colin, many thanks to him for that. A hazy golden/orange coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, dank, citrus, grapefruit on the nose. Taste is much the same hoppy, dank, slightly malty, citrus, grapefruit and a little rye. Quite bitter but in a good way. A quality IPA from California.

Hazy yellow color with a really cream medium white head. Taste is resinous with citrus, though more resin on the aftertaste. Malt balance is perfect. Carbonation has some of the finest bubbles, and LOTS of them, that Ive encountered, especially in an IPA. Dry, and super-easy drinking.

Slightly hazy yellow with minimal head. Aroma is where it shines: resinous with citrus and berry notes. Taste is same, but lighter, and dry with clean bitterness into the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Light Amber color. Aroma is hops, citrus and some fruits. Taste is a nice combination of citrus, pine, hops and fruits. A good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy, white-yellow (like a wit), with minimal head. Aroma is full of a very strong grapefruit, with other florals and some grassiness. Flavor is big and bold--citrus/grapefruit, with loads of hop bite in the finish. Very bitter beer with a pretty dry finish. Top-notch.

A single-hop IPA featuring Nelson Sauvin brewed with rye in the West Coast style? Yes to all of that, please. A golden orange pour with a snowy, rocky head. Grapefruit, orange, pineapple, mango, peach cream, lemongrass, and bread aromas. Flavors are complex yet beautifully cohesive. Lemon balm, spicy rye, tangerine, vinous grape, and tropical juice. Mouthfeel is thick, semi-dry, crisp, sticky, balanced. Just beautiful.

Pours hazy gold into a shaker. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to coat surface. Tropical fruit and onion aromas. Soft with sweet and sour caramel upfront turning to earthly pumpernickel in the lasting finish.

22oz bottle (Green Flash brewed version) pours slightly hazy pale orane with a finger of head. Nose is grassy orange, melon, tropical citrus. Taste is medium bitterness, crisp grassy tropical fruit, tangerine, citrus, white grape, melon, mango. Finishes dry, low malt, touch of toasted crust spice, medium bitter, nice soft mouthfeel with crisp tropical fruit, orange candy, white grape, and grassy citrus. Very good.

Bottle

Pours hazy orange w light head. 

Juicy nose with lots of grapes in it, and taste is just the same. 
Juice, Juice, Juice and so easy drinkable. Has a sharp grape bitternes that just disappears as quick as it appears and ends up dwelling on a really light body and citrus fruits.

One of the rare instances that Im blown away by an IPA. Aroma was big and juicy. Mango with dank cat piss and heavy pine and earth. Pour was a medium hazy gold with a thin off white film for a head. Taste was big and hoppy. Those strong hop flavors are amplified in the taste with a nice strong bitterness for a backbone. As soon as the swallow hit, the rye spiciness resonated and dried the finish up nicely. I might say this is the best IPA Ive had all year (but its only February so well see)! Nice carbonation
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. It poured a hazy golden color with an off-white head. The aroma was of malts, citrus and hops. The taste was similar to the aroma with more malts, citrus, hops and grapefruit. Very tasty.

Cloudy golden, slight orange. Fantastic aroma, white grape, wood, slight grass. Full body, light carbonation, delicious fruity melon, Berry, and slight rye spice. Best rye ipa Ive had by far. Fantastic

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Full mouth feel with great flavor. Heavy hoppiness that is really well balanced. 

Rerated at the brewery 7/20/16- outstanding compared even to all of the fine competitors on tap here.

BBD 6/18/16. Pours a hazy gold with a touch of amber. Outstanding head volume, world class lacing and retention.

World class nose of tropical hops (mango, pineapple), citrus (orange) and a strong dank background over a touch of biscuit.

Heavy light body with a smooth texture that has an oily slick element. World class carbonation with a nice effervescent middle that coats the tongue and a finely bubbled prickly finish.

The flavor profile is borderline world class. Complexity is a bit weak, but the intent is to showcase the Nelson Sauvin hop and that is done in a world class fashion. Balance is perfect for the objective as a subtle cracker biscuit sweetness arrives in the middle to contrast a tasty bitterness that is quite mild for the style. Hop flavor is the name of the game with this one. The flavors of the nose all arrive...citric followed by tropical as the sweetness of the middle allows the tropicals to shine. Then a significant dankcentric element takes command and holds through the finish. The finish hints at dryness initially, but makes a lingering flourish underneath an amazing blend of tropical and dank hop flavor. This a bomber...Alpine / GF, 6 pack this bad boy!!

Bottle from The Beer Junction, Seattle; bb 16 Jun 2016This is Nelson Sauvin juice, very pungent aroma, citrusy flavor; tropical, passion fruit, cat piss; a bit resiny in the finish; and because those guys at Alpine know their business, the body is dry, the malt flavor is very delicate, a bit crackery, so to not cover the hop.Fantastic.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Ive wanted to try this for a while, and was very happy to find bottles at the Last Drop. Relatively light colored pour, good-sized white head with great lacing, nice gentle new-school nose. Wow, Nelson hops are so good. Like citra, but less...citra. The rye is really subtle but its there and its a serious addition. Yep, this is a 100% IPA. Its not just pine and orange rind any more, bitches. 

Further comments: After a few more rounds of this one, the previous rating holds up. Id probably go 4.1 rather than 4.2, but thats splitting hairs. As it gets a bit less fresh, the onions and garlic come out a bit further, but it still pwns my standby Alphadelic by virtue of a less aggressive malt base and less in the way of lingering bitter oils on the tongue.

The beer pours hazy golden orange with a dense of white head. The aroma has funk, dankness, tropical fruit, grape, pale malt and only a mild hint of rye. It has a medium body with some fruitiness and some soft carbonation. The flavor starts with good amount of pale malt, rye spice, hoppy spice, citrus, tropical fruit and some bitterness. The finish has more tropical fruits, green grapes and woody/spiciness. Quite nice.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2016 First time I had it (2/3/16) I wrote: Distinctive. Resinous woody aroma, latex paint, with pear and pepper and distant musty pine. Good. Probably unbelievable fresh and on tap. Great white lacing. Second time I had it (3/8/16) I would say it was like a Grapefruit Sculpin. No grapefruit has been added, but you would almost swear it had been. It was like a completely different beer. Not sure which bottle I liked better, they were both good.

Draught at RateBeer Best festival. Light hazy orange liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, light blackberries, light grain and mango. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of citrus, tangerine, blackberries and light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great stuff.

Draft at city beer store. Translucent golden yellow coloured pour with a sticky white head. Aroma is big nelson Hoo, tropical fruit, grapes and burnt clutch. Flavour is composed of burnt grass, zesty lemon, burnt pineapple, light grape, resin. Big nelson character. Palate is medium bodied. Highish carbonation. Solid. IPA.
Drank with Thijs at Waalwijk 24-1-2016. Nice, bitter, really fresh and good-to-drink IPA. Thanks Robert for the gift :).

January 23, 2016. Bottle, best before June 18, 2016. The label says brewed and bottled by Alpine Beer Company so I assume its the original version. 
Hazy golden with a medium sized white head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy with mango, pineapple, gooseberries, lemon some pine and grapes. Taste is light to medium sweet, juicy, soft medium grassy bitterness. Finish is slightly dry grassy bitterness and light sweet with lots of juicy tropical fruits with some lemon, grapes and gooseberry notes as well. Medium bodied, smooth, slightly dry texture, soft to average carbonation. 

Great juicy, hoppy and drinkable IPA. 


Original rating.

July 26, 2015. On tap at RattleNHum. 
8-4-8-4-16=40

Unfiltered and hazy golden yellow. Possibly best smelling IPA Ive had. Super juicy and lots of grapefruit. Taste is grapefruit, ideal bitterness, and slightly sweet. Super crisp abs refreshing with medium light mouthfeel and dry finish. Top 3 IPAs Ive had. Similar to fresh Lagunitas Sucks but better. Green flash is reproducing this one well at least. World class beer! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is fruit, berries and a slight spicy undertones. The flavor is hops/Nelson/mild hop resin, berries, mild sweetness and a rather dry/medium bitter finish.

Hazy yellow pour with white head. Aroma is light lemon zest and a touch of resin. Flavor is light sweet malt start with a floral citrus bitter. Smooth carbonation. clean crisp easy to drink refreshing
Guest tap @ Green Flash. Hazy yellow, lasting lacy white head. Big green hop character, some gooseberry and cat pee, restrained malt sweetness, extremely bitter finish. Fantastic.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 651 ml. bottle. BBD 24 May 16. Pours a medium, well retained, off white head, with slight lacing over a hazy yellow (SRM 3) body......nose is pine, resin, citrus peel from the hops, hints of toasted malts, balance to the hops.....taste is mildly floral honey sweet, with light pine, hints of resin, mild citrus, slight allium, rye, becoming moderately bitter, balance to the hops......mouth feel, medium slightly sticky body, minimal alcohol, moderate carbonation. Even though it was brewed with a "down under" hop, this is very "left coast in style. The aromas and flavors of the hops are quite excellent, with just enough malt character, with the rye addition to almost balance the hops. BJCP 9/3/16/4/7

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co. and 12 oz. dispensed to a Czech-pils glass, displaying a hazed, light gold color, with a frothy layer of white head foam that slowly diminished, leaving a sheet-like coating of lacing on the glass. The nose was expressively dank and citrusy, with notes of lemon & grapefruit, a bit of cattiness, and light grass & greenery. Medium bodied, with decent carbonation, the taste added a lingering citrus & rind-like bitterness, along with some tartness. Rye influence was negligible, but found this single hopped IPA to be quite tasty. Recall past familiarity with this hop used in combination with others, but first time as the star. Gives the style a fresh variation.

Hazy lemon yellow pour ith a big frothy white head. looks like a witbier.
Hop aroma that has light pine and some lemony citrus.
The flavor has light bitterness on the front and some malt sweetness coming in to join the bitterness in the finish. Very drinkable, well balanced IPA.

Pours a slightly hazy light gold with an off-White head. The smell is toasted malt, tropical notes, grapes. The taste is mild spice, melon, white grape ending dry. The body is light+ with nice tight carbonation.
Golden color with a white head. Aroma contains tons of pine, orange, lemons. The flavor is bitter and full of resin. Odd for a non IIPA. Some malt to balance it out. This is top notch stuff.

My first Nelson. Very good and very refreshing. Pours a cloudy gold with an aroma that is predominantly fruity hops. Soft and malty body with some grassy and fruity hops throughout. No typical rye spice and no
Bitterness. Very well put together.

Draft. Milky orange color with a minimal white head. Some lacing. Aroma is peaches, grass, orange rind. 
Finishes with a bit of lingering bitterness.

Tap at hamiltons tavern, san diego. Hazy yellow color, white head. Amazing aroma has mango, pineapple, fruits, hops. Nice fresh hoppy taste, mango, fruits, some malts on the back. Best ipa tasted in a while.

Pours a light golden amber with a white head that mildly laces. Great mixed floral and fruit aromas. Medium body with firm carbonation. Flavor is floral with grapefruit. Finishes bitter and floral. Great ale.
22oz bottle. Pours cloudy light golden/yellow. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, pine. Flavor of citrus, tangerine, spicy rye. Quite lovely aroma with a spicy rye finish.

650 ml. bb 24 May 2016. Pours a foggy golden with a meringue topping of foam. Nose is honey with the beeswax, evergreen resin, toast and spicy toffee. Flavors of papaya, pineapple, resiny green herb, toast and honey. Long finish has some wooden hop notes. Light body is watery and smooth with low carbonation and an easy drinking balance.

Bomber at Lincoln Wine Bar. Mixed reactions on this one, but I really liked it. Its got a creamy body, a rye sharpness, and a citrusy, semi-sweet finish. Some unique flavors to it I couldnt really place, though.

From my Sauvin glass from Pretentious Beer Glass Company, because, yknow, it seemed appropriate. Anyway, this was good. Lots of grapefruity hops in both the aroma and flavor, and some lightly (very lightly) smokey notes and toasty flavors. Really good.

20/XI/15 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ home - BB: n/a (2015-1633) Thanks to Beerlover_Ben for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy blond beer, creamy off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: citrus, bit sourish, funky, kiwi, lychee, bit resinous, malty, very intense smell! MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: citrus, bit spicy, sweet malts, grassy, grapefruit, other fruits. Aftertaste: very fruity, dry, pineapple, grassy, grapefruit, very bitter.
This beer blows almost every IPA out of the water. Every time I drink it I am more impressed that I still feel it is one of my top beers that I have ever had.

Golden pour. Citrusy grapefruit with light berry, pineapple and a touch of rye spice. Flavor is lemon and grapefruit bitterness with tropical fruit, berry and a generous malt backing/light rye. Grapefruit and rye finish. Another winner.
Bomber. Pours Golden Yellow with good white head. Aroma is dank citrus. Taste is Fruity Citrus with a little alcohol. Great beer!

22 oz bomber pours a hazy orange color with a nice white head. Aromas of citrus, grapefruit, floral. Medium bodied, a great IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle shared. The beer is a hazy gold with a white head of foam. Decent retention. The head stays a velvety consistency. The aroma has mild citrusy hop character with nuances of tropical fruits and pine. The taste is somewhat papery and sweet. Some bitterness does come through, though. Tastes old, even though I know it isnt.

Bottle from Bear World. Pours clear straw with some head and lots of lacing. Nose is vegetable and pine. Flavours of pine, maybe some garlic, earthy bitterness, bright pine with lots of peppery rye in the finish. Taste is medium/big bitter, light sweet. Full silky body, really silky for an IPA. Lively carbonation and a lasting bitterness. Awesome beer.
Straw colored pour, white fluffy head. Mango, citrus, dankness. Nelson is a fantastic single hop IPA.

Bottled. Best by 04/20/16. Pours straw-colored (slightly deeper), big white head. Aroma is super dank. Slight grapefruit/mango, some tropical notes, but first and foremost, dank. Rye malt adds a nice element. I dig it. Flavor is dank too. Rye is slightly there, but not super prevalent. Excellent example of Nelson hops. If you want a pretty dank beer, this is it.

Tap at Apex in Portland. Pours haxy yellow with white head. Aroma is super herbal, floral, grapefruit, lemon. Taste is light bodied, crisp, bitter throughout, extreme citrus. Overall, okay, nothing too impressive but enjoyable

bottle, from Highcraft Beer Market, Cary. best by 20 APR 16. good aroma, sweet, orange and pine. clean golden orange color, ok head and lace, though I poured kind of slow, bitter sweet flavor. medium body, thick creamy mouthfeel, sweet bitter finish. its real good. maybe better than my score indicates, but thats how I feel right now, like flavor and finish the best. nice to have this pass through NC
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: on tap @ Vino Bellissimo / Lima OH --- Soapy, dirty grapefruit color, mottled head cover, curtain of lace. Aroma of pine hops. Taste is malt that is immediately joined by smooth pine hops on the swallow. Light fizz shows, then a much bigger hop shot closes things out. Too much hop presence for me. Average.

On tap at Duckworths Park location. Clear golden with small/medium white head. Aroma is herbal hops, medium body, light/medium carbonation, and pretty good lacing. Taste is herbal hops and slightly bitter finish.

Aroma is funky, pine, floral, zesty citrus and not at all sweet, then rye spice. Appearance is beautiful, slightly hazy orange/yellow, white head. Taste is orange peel, pine, floral hops, very very bitter, rye. Mouthfeel is medium body and light carbonation, far from crisp. Overall, I really REALLY wanted this to be good but its just ok.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a thin layer of off white head. Aroma and taste of crisp malts, citrus hops, grapefruit.

Tap. Creamy white head, hazy marigold body. Passion fruit, guava, slight spicy hop, and rounded hop sweetness in the aroma. Guava, mango rind earthiness, and a peach skin sweet end. Bitter for sure. Thicker body.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2015 Draught at Deep Ellum, 11/17/15.Bright tangerine-apricot liquid shows good clarity and a medium-sized white head with moderate retention.I love this hop and the nose does justice to it. Lots of stonefruit, very big and juicy, with bright orange marmalade accents. Theres a good deal of malt behind it, adding lots of honey and white bread-like character. Fresh and highly aromatic, but theres somehow a touch of resin here or sharpness of some sort.  As well, theres a definite plastic note thats quite strong but not terribly bothersome.The flavor confirms this as, though the flavors of the hop are delicious, the beer is just heavily, heavily bitter. Way more than is necessary to balance the pale malt sweetness that creates a medium to medium-full body. With every sip I keep trying to focus and enjoy the flavors, but my palate gets further an further harried by all of this obnoxious bitterness. Nearly exact same situation as with the other beers Ive tried from them lately: duet and hoppy birthday. I have fond memories of Pure Hoppiness, and I dont think my tastes have changed to be less tolerant of heavily bitter IPAs (have always hated em), so I dont really get whats going on with Alpines mediocrity these days (I usually like Green Flash, though I guess they have a high propensity for making overly bitter beers too). Oh well.

Pours a golden with one finger head with mild lacing. Are of citrus and tropical fruit dominates. Toasted malt. Moderate to full bitterness. Medium bodies. Carbonation a touch brisk but still good. Excellent moderate to heavy bitterness. Well done

Aroma is fruit punch, tangerine soaked wet towel, 
Pours a nice white foam head with lingering cirus (spelling?) cloud 
formation. Mellow, easy to drink, little bitterness, pineapple on the finish

Clear golden pour white pour with light spotty lacing .... Aroma of tropical fruits, piney, grapefruit, mango .... Taste is of spicy rye, grapefruit, piney hops, tropical fruits, mango and caramel malts .... Very dry bitter and spicy with a nice lingering tropical and grapefruit .... Abv hidden well.... Awesome IPA

bottle. Deep golden with one finger head. Light rye body with just a bit of spiciness. Solid Nelson Sauvin hops. Fairly low bitterness, but very nice hop flavors. Citrus/tropical mainly. Very good stuff, not sure that it meets the hype though.
Bottle at tderoeck's place. Thanks for sharing Ben. Hopforward! Dry, bitter, nice stuff! Cool!

Where and how:  tasting, bottle 355ml 
Aroma: slightly pungent , brown sugar, mild funk with musk. Up front semi dry with softer finish.
 Appearance :

Base: hazy, gold

Taste: In one word  solid. Semi dry with good hop character. Extra dimension with its pungent hints. Somewhat chewy and with developing alcohol heat as you drink.
 other notes  very nice brew.

Tap mad mex. Smells like rather perfumy fresh IPA. Big strong ipa impressions, but with a slightly lighter palate. Bitterness builds thru the session. Become a little resinous and astringent after a while.

text: bottled, dark orangey golden color with frothy foam, has some green onion to the aroma and flavor, nice hop and malt balance, good finish with a touch of the rye

Bottle from Hickeys in Milford. Pours out a hazy "greenish" gold color. Frothy off-white head. Huge aromatic punch of fresh citrus, herbs and spice. Flavor is wonderfully fresh and tasty of bitter melon, citrus, grapefruit rind and lightly sweet malts. Long, lingering bitter finish. Begs another sip! Very good.

Bomber. Pale gold and cloudy. Tropical fruit, almost minty aroma. Flavor is sweet hop juice. Period. Tropical fruit that is expertly balanced. Just enough malt to keep it from overwhelming hop. Great exhibition of nelson sauvin.

P.s. How is this distributed in south carolina?
Cloudy golden color in Green Flash bottle bottle. Nelson Sauvin hops are interesting...but I catch some onion.

From large format "green flash" bottle into a pint glass. Hazy golden yellow color with large off white head leaving lots of lacing behind. Juicy fruit, oranges, lemon peel, lime zest, white pepper nose, fantastic. Light to medium body, dry finish, light to medium bitterness, medium to high carbonation. Long lemon drop finish, some light biscuit, dryness at the back of the tongue lasts for a while. Great beer.

Big bottle from FLBC. Pours clear yellow-gold. Large white head, long retention, lots of lacing. Aroma is ridiculous-- potent, dank, hoppy. Flavor is much the same-- long coming on, but long-lasting, too. The rye balances things out a bit, very drinkable. Bitterness at the end, but not much. Fruity sweetness dominates this amazing IPA. Lovely, once again, Alpine.

Bottle. Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly lasting. Body is medium to dark yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (resin, apricot, grapefruit), with notes of plastic and sauteed onions. Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, creamy/oily/watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly astringent, moderately alcoholic.

Lots of onion stink in this one, phew! Some plastic too, so its hard to enjoy the hop aroma much. Good flavor balance for the style, pretty clean bitterness with low acidity, and a nice lasting head, but I just cant bring myself to drink it due to the aromatic problems.

Hazy yellow orange pour with a lasting white head. Lacing coats the glass. Aroma is orange, white white wine, and rye. Taste is grapefruit zest, white wine, rye spice, and some candied orange sweetness. Soft carbonation. Awesome IPA.

(bomber) Pours a super hazy light yellow with a white head. Looks like a hefeweizen. Aroma is fruit-forward with honeydew melon, navel orange, green kiwi, and a little vegetal lettuce element thrown in for good measure (likely due to the rye). Flavor holds abundant spicy rye, cinnamon, romaine lettuce, with white grape and peach that transitions abruptly to a quite astringent bitterness that is a bit tea-like (grassy darjeeling) before moving further on to a bit of cinnamon stick. Mouthfeel is medium and carb is appropriate. Overall this is a solid beer, and Im glad to see AlGreenPineFlash here in the state.

Bottle (Green Flash distributed). Pours a very hazy pale orange color with an ample white head that sticks to my teku glass as it recedes. Smells of juicy, fruity hops, floral, a touch dank. Taste has the same fruitiness that is eventually overtaken by a medium, assertive bitterness. Medium bodied, just less than average carbonation. Bitter finish. A wonderful IPA. Taster... Pale yellow with thin white head... Smells like a meadow in spring and tastes like a fresh picked wildflower bouquet ... Excellent!

650 ml. bottle split by 3 @ Exclusive S&G Tasting: Special guest 77ships. Thanks to Mathieu87 & PriorL. Hazy golden bubbly white head. Nose is rich citrus hops, hay with thick but pleasant dough, light yoghurt yeast body, lemon. Taste is same yeast / dough profile with hay, thick citrus hops, white hay, faint grass, light tropical, very balanced. Dough body. Very nice beer.
On tap at source...awesome excellent hoppy brew. Spicy and earthy balance of hops ij flavor and aroma. Smooth malty balance as well. Superb.

Bottle from richiesd. Light copper pour with a light tan head that fades to a nice film and semi-thick ring around the edge of the glass. Fresh floral hops, some mandarin orange, nectarine, apricot, well balanced malt presence with some biscuit and caramel. Moderate carbonation and strong body, creamy mouthfeel with a nice bitterness that grows but doesnt overwhelm, leaves a nice citrus and semi-resin taste on the palate. Really liked this.
10/15/204. On tap at the brewpub. Amber with a white head. Big hoppy aromas, fresh floral notes, pine, citrus, its all there. Bitter and dry, balanced and complex. Awesome IPA.

Appearance: hazy pale gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: intensive citrus, mandarines, turning very bitter, dry in the finish. Overall: fantastic IPA, excellent aroma and palate. Pint at Alpine Brewing, Alpine.

Wish list cross off at Toronado SD did NOT disappoint. Stood toe to toe (at least) with Blind Pig and lives to tell the tale. Huge dank tropical fruity hops in the nose and flavor. Light spice.Just loved every sip. Nothing else I can say... 4/13 Fresh bottle practically exploding with a wonderful vibrant fruity aroma and flavor without high abv while maintaining balance. One the best IPAs Ive ever had. Aroma REALLY close to a 10."
On tap at Flavor in Half Moon Bay, CA. Pours a straw gold. Aroma is grass, hay, spruce. Taste is grassy hops, earth, mild bitterness. Like a Pilsner meets an IPA. Very unique and nice!
Draft at the brewery. Cloudy yellow color. Dank hop aroma. Mandarin oranges in the flavor with some mild bitterness. Super drinkable. Pleasant.

Obtained by trade. Pours a clear golden, light copper color with minimal head. Aroma of floral hops, spruce and some grass. Flavor of strong floral hops, spruce, grass, biscuity malts, exotic fruitiness, caramel and some herbal notes. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and good carbonation. Finishes very bitter, floral, herbal and light sweet. Very well balanced.

65cl, as Alpine Beer Company Nelson, American brew, thx alot to Secret Santa!, very complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly woody/floral, balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!

A - pours clear bright yellow with 1 finger white head. S - centennial hops dominate. Tea bitters. Soapy piney lemon zesty hops. Nice. Smells balanced. M - bitter and bright. High carb. Nice rich ipa body. Full palate. T - hops and a half. Centennial (sun tea) lemon zest and piney hops with slight soap and grasses. End is bitter and hoppy. Nice caramel malts in the middle. slight vegetal notes. O - nice ipa.

Bottle shared at El Bait Shop, thank you guys! Pour is cloudy yellow yellow with a thin white. Aroma is so clean with loads of grapefruit and passion fruit. Awesome. Flavor is also loaded with grapefruit and pineapple. So pure and so clean. An amazing IPA.

Draft, City Beer, San Fran. Aroma is just great. Grassy, white grape and some citrus punch. Flavor is just like it smells and damn bold! Mouth feel is spicy and grassy, light grape notes in the thourghout. Great effervescent, spicy, zing in the mouthfeel. Damn I would drink this again. Nicely crafted
Pours a golden color with a white head. Citrus, floral, pine, hop and malt aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a citrus hop and floral finish.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Incredible juicy citrus aroma. Cloudy amber. Incredible citrus and grape taste, sweet and bitter. Nice balance, leaning towards bitter. Long grapefruit finish. Full sweet body. Wonderful IPA.

Draught at City Beer SF. Hazy yellow color, white head. Bitter taste with grapefruit, floral hops, mango, pine and a hint of resin. Bitter finish with grapefruit, hops, pine and a bit of mango. Excellent IPA.

Bottle from the great Ontape ! Pours a slightly hazy warm golden color with a finger of white foam. Nose is pungent from the moment I poured it into a glass. Juicy grapefruit, earthy peach fuzz, fuji apple, orange pith and soe dank pine. Palate follows beautifully... bright hop juice, layers of sweet citrus fruit on the front and some added rye character plays nicely mid to late palate as the dank earth bitterness rolls in and dries out the finish. Yum !

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 On tap at Enzo?s BBQ in Oceanside, CA. Pours opaque golden orange with a frothy pure white head. Aroma is tangerine, sweet pineapple, grapefruit, dank hops, bready malt. Taste is more citrus than anything... mostly tangerine and grapefruit with some lemon zest and pine. Extremely balanced and live the rye spice backdrop. Very smooth and crisp... Phenomenal. Leaves good to heavy lacing

2011 backlog. Bomber. Pours clear light gold with a 3 finger white head. The nose is dank hops, cannabis and caramel. The taste is hop oils, citrus, toffee and grapefruit rind. Medium mouth feel. Nice IPA. 3.8

Cloudy orange with light golden lacing. Aroma of citrus with some serious rotten funk (in a good way) flavor is delicious hoppy crispness that is soon overtaken by barnyard/citrus/rye. Very interesting and complex. Enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 19, 2015 Tap, orange pour, white head, nose is citrus, taste is piney, hoppy, grapefruit, awesome.
Very cloudy orange. Great piny smells. Smooth bitter that fades and cleans up very fast. Lasting bitter but malty smooth.

No retention and no lacing. Smells of pineapple, grapefruit and guava. Tastes of tropical fruits and semi-sweet malt. Sweet finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2014 Bomber received in trade. Thank you StefanSD! Pours hazy pale yellowish golden with a rather small frothy white head that leaves lots of trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity with crackers, white grapes, grapefruit juice, pine needles, minerals, freshly cut grass, pineapple juice, mango, lemon balm, gooseberries and lemon zest. Taste is bitter and fruity with whole grain crackers, grapefruit juice, gooseberries, freshly cut grass, pine needles, grape skins, pineapple juice, unripe mango, lychee and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is dry, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Finish is bitter and fruity with whole grain crackers, grapefruit juice, pineapple juice, pine needles, freshly cut grass, gooseberries, grape skins and lemon zest. Possibly the perfect Nelson IPA.

Bottled at Alex
Hazy yellow with a white head. 
Grapes, pine and diesel in the aroma. 
Rather light body. 
Pine-apple, pine -needles and grapes in the flavour. 
Light, fresh and extremely pleasant!

Murky orange in colour with a small white head, light lacing. The aroma is very tropical, pineapple, some pine. The flavour is filled with tropical hops, citrus and a bit of pine. Bitter mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carbonation. Finishes long and hoppy. A very, very good IPA, so hoppy yet has very good balance.
Opened March 5, 2010.

On tap at the brewpub in Alpine. 

Appearance: Hazy pale yellow with a durable white colored head that leaves a temporary coating on the glass. 

Aroma: Hops, with hints of pineapple, grapefruit, starfruit and other tropical notes. 

Flavor: Fruity, slightly tart, and only moderately bitter at its peak. Moderate complexity. The hop flavor builds over time but nevers becomes harsh or overbearing 

Feel: Light-medium body with near medium carbonation.

O: a distinctive IPA. Recommended.

Draft at Hopwater Distribution in San Francisco, California. The pour is hazy golden orange with a smallish off white head. Head falls slowly, with nice lacing. The aroma is big citrus tropical hop upfront, opening up to soft fruit and a general dank resin. Engaging nose. The taste is big and fresh, hop is the focus with tropical fruit, citrus brightness and a general pear peach fruitiness. The dank and resin carry the finish, and are more evident as the beer warmed. The palate is medium bodied, soft carbonation and the dry resin finish. Tasty IPA.
Pours a nice orange-golden color with white head. Spice, grass, light fruits, and some pine on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes clean.

Thanks to Colin for sharing this at a recent tasting. Hazy yellow tropical pineapple juice color. Mint, alcohol, citrus (lemon-mango). Restrained bitterness, light body, soft carb. Muted flavor all around. Grassy. Surprisingly unremarkable.

AROMA: Tropical fruits, spice, pine, bitterness, and a hint of pineapple and sweet malts, absolutely amazing smell to this beer!
APPEARANCE: Pours very yellow with a slight golden hue to it, was quite surprised with the color of this IPA, it looks more like a blonde ale, but it still looks good
TASTE: Blown away in this category! In the beginning you get a wonderful blend of spice and pine, which transitions to an amazing blend of spice and tropical fruits, and then finishes with spice, tropical fruits, pine, pineapple, and some bitterness. Every flavor in this beer is so perfectly balanced and you get so much of every flavor, and this beer tastes truly incredible!
PALATE: Perfect execution here, crisp, light refreshing, leaves your mouth a little dry which leaves you craving it more and more!
OVERALL: This is an incredible beer, easily hits number 2 on my top IPAs list! You have to try this beer!
Had thanks to my boy weezel. Hazy yellow color with a nice head. A nice variety of tropical fruit dominate the aroma and taste. Hops are excellent. Very tasty IPA

Hazy yellow color, frothy white head. Mildly sweet, peppery aroma of citrus fruits (grapefruit, orange, lemon), coriander, and other spices. A lot less sweetness in the taste than in the nose. Lively carbonation, a little more than light-bodied, and a bitter finish
At brewery. Pours hazy gold. Huge hop punch with lemon and orange (grape?) citrus peel. Big and resinous, full of flavor all the way to the end. Aggressive bite. Delicious.
on tap, decent head. Dont let the cloudy color fool you. Lemon finish, but not overpowering, great from first to last sips
22oz bottle pours hazy orange with an off-white head. Peppery pine aroma. Tropical fruit lemon hop taste.
Awesome aromas of mango, white grapes, tropical hops. Color is a light straw color. Taste is awesome tropical fruits, mineral water, Viognier wine and a hit of lemon at the end. Really good.

Keg at Stone Liberty Station, San Diego 18/04/14.
Murky orange with a moderate off white swirl and edgework.
Nose is skunky hops, pine resin, bitter hop twang, dank, bitter grapefruit, orange pith.
Taste comprises bitter hops, pine, straw, grapefruit.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, agressive hop bitterness in the close.
Super solid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: On tap, pours a hazy dull yellow, thin head, lots of lacing. Peppery, spicy nose, hints of dry dust, pine resin. Spicy hoppy attack, not the expected west coast floral/grassy attack. very clean long dry finish. different but great IPA

Hazy straw gold in color... Aroma is peppery rye, spicy hops... Lots of earthy notes, almost smells like a Saison.... Flavor is very earthy and peppery like a Saison, but still moderately bitter from floral hops... Amazingly good, best of both worlds

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle obtained in a trade, poured into a snifter. Appearance was a bit hazy and orange, medium white head, left decent lacing. Aroma was hoppy and dank. Pine, peach, mango, floral, grapefruit. I found myself smelling it each sip that I took because it smelt so wonderful. Taste was just as good - notes of pineapple, pine, mangos, peaches, some lemon citrus, and hints of floral following the smell. Medium body, with a smooth texture, lively carb, and a nice finish. Small hints of alcohol noticed, but not over-powering. Absolutely amazing beer.
Heavenly citrus aroma. Mild dry citrus hop flavor, with a nice gritty spice from the rye. No lingering bitterness, light to medium bodied. A great showcase of the Nelson hop!

I did not think this was much of an IPA. It is cloudy and sweet and not what I would expect for an IPA. I last rated an Anchor IPA and I thought that was more of an example. Both are very good to me. Overall, the Nelson is smooth and enjoyable although it reminded me more of a strong wheat. Because of this experience, it has given me an idea to homebrew a Wheat IPA.

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2015 On tap at Simzy?s LB poured into footed stange. Hazy golden body with a thin white head that settles to a thin ring. Lace rings. Aroma is piney, with grape skin, herbs, rye spice, citrus, and grass. Taste is initially dank and musty with moderate bitterness featuring the same flavors as the nose. Some malt and tropical fruit sweetness comes through. Rye spiciness hits on the swallow. Medium body, thin texture, moderate carbonation, and a dry bitter finish.

Taster from tap @ 38 Degrees Ale House, Alhambra, CA. Blond color, cloudy. Dense white head with good lacing. Aromas: pine, citrus, lychee, flowery hops. Retronasal theres fruit/citrus first, then hopbitterness, lychee and resin. Flavor us moderate to full bitter with a light malty sweet backbone. Medium bodied. Rather high carbonation. Finishes rather dry with a delicate bitterness. Lovely!
On tap at capitol beer and taproom. Pours haze yellow golden. With white head. Nice hop Aroma. Taste is great hop bitterness with fruits and some pine .
On tap at Harrys Hofbrau. Lemon, citrus bright aroma. Hazy straw with a white head with massive webbing. Taste is tropical and citrus. Moderate bitterness.
Tap from city beer. Pours unclear yellow. White head. Bitter. Hop, lemon, citrus nose. Lemon flavour! Grapefruit. Some grass. Interesting.

Draught at Stone World Bistro Liberty Station, San Diego. Hazy golden/orange beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Hoppy pine apple aroma, peach, mango, passion fruit, pine needles, grapes, floral, grapes fruit, nectar, some caramel. Hoppy pine apples flavor, mango, passion fruit, floral, pine needles, caramel, oranges, peach, some nectar. Full bodied and just wonderful! Maybe my new favorite IPA in the world!

Sampled on tap at ale arsenal. A really awesome brew that really doesnt feel like an ipa. It feels more like a wheat or strong ale. Highly carbonated but the hops are great and unique. An awesome sampling ale!

(bottle - 22 oz) Hazy orange pour with a thin off-white head. Funky citrus aroma. Not much pine. Flavor starts off with mild citrus and then a peppery and earthy hop note. Definitely no mistaking what hop is being used. Surprisingly clean finish without much bitterness. Thanks to Ryan for sharing this.

Week old bottle thanks to Diego! Pours a cloudy yellow good with medium frothy head. The aroma is a strong fruity hop and grapefruit. Medium mouthfeel with strong sweet hop, light dryness and bitter finish. Realy fresh, so good.
A world class display of my favorite hop in the universe. Excellent stone fruit character, bits of citrus, lightly spicy.

Probably one of the best ipas in the world!

Bottle. Light, hazy, hay coloured pour, white head. Smells great! Mango, passionfruit, pine needles. Medium bitterness. Passionfruit, citrus, pineapple, resin in taste. Little residual sugar, dry but at the same time quite big bodied. Long, smooth, tasty finish. How I would love to have some locals available that tastes like this.

A- Pours a light tangerine hue with a nice, 1.5 finger frothy white head that leaves decent lacing on the way down.

S- Grassy, Citrus, tons of grapefruit, mixed with light sweet fruits.

T- Bready and a tad spicy that leads into lots of citrus, blood orange, tangerine, grapefruit and has a nice bitter finish.

M- Medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Bottle via GT2 (thanks!), who just might have turned me on to this whole rating thing for good. Sampled on 3/14. Pours a lovely, hazy pale gold, minimal lacing. Blond small white head. Sweet tropical aroma. Flavor follows fruity with bitter finish.
Bottle from Steasy! Hazy yellow gold pour with a white head. Citrus and floral smoothed by the rye. This is excellent!

L: Light pale and straw in color. Strong and this pillow like foamy head, lingers quite a bit as well. Slight haze.

S: Citrus and tropical upfront then the rye hits you with some faint black licorice and rubber notes.

T: Again citrus upfront with rye blending in nicely fading into a real nice pine.

M: Light and easy to drink. Really nice mouth-feel to his one.

O: Really nice beer, would love to have this all the time. One thing I notice about Alpine is its kinda like my homebrew, at the bottom has some hop bits in it lol.
Bottle thanks to Taylor. Very grapey and floral. A very light malt backbone. Solid. Horrible review
Pours clear golden color. Huge piney and danky aroma. Taste is like licking a pine cone... Huge piney and danky flavor.
bottle from tleaver33. pours gold with a billowing white head, lots of lacing. nose is musty, earth. taste is huge with ripe pineapple, some grapefruit. moderate bitterness, balanced. light body.
Bottle. Hazy golden orange color. Nose of tropical fruit and a hint of sweetness. Taste of tropical fruit, sweet, a bit bitter on the end. Wonderful!

Glass: Pint glass
From: Alpine Beer Company in Alpine, Calif.

Purchased: Jan. 5, 2014
Consumed: Jan. 5, 2014

Poured a golden, straw, hazy color with one finger of off-white head. Good amount of sporadic spiderweb lacing on the sides of the glass. Average-to-above average retention.

Smelled grapefruit, pine, orange rind, citrus hops, floral hops, spices and resin hops.

Tasted grapefruit and initially it reminded me of a toned down Pliny the Elder. Pine, resin, citrus, orange rind, tangerine and light caramel malts, all in a pretty bitter form.

Light body. Oily-to-creamy texture. Lively carbonation. Long, bitter, citrusy finish.

This beer lived up to the hype. Just fantastic.

Bottle shared by Nick... much thanks! I love Nelson hops and I love rye, so I was very excited to try this. Enjoyed in a red solo cup. Pours a opaque orange peach color with a nice white head. Smell is awesome peach, mango, tropical fruits, hay. Taste follows, slight spice from the rye, juicy peaches and mangos. Slight cereal malty backbone. Good carbonation, great clean finish. One of the best IPAs I have ever had.

Bottle thanks to 50belair:   Bright straw, cloudy, thin to moderate frothy white head, nice lacing.   Bright hoppy nose, slightly floral and citrusy.   Not as bright on the tongue, a little subdued you might say, or not as bright as the aroma.   Fragrant on the tongue, floral, pale citrus notes.   Smells a bit brighter than the tongue delivers.   Very clean, hoppy without a big malt base.   Moderate body and mouthfeel.   Wished it were thicker, but for an IPA its very much on par.   Clean citrusy finish, citrus peel and pith become stronger.   Smooth and easy, not as harsh or caustic as many other IPAs.   Soft, smooth, clean, witih a moderate aroma and flavor profile.   Doesnt overpower anywhere.   Solid example of the style!

Bottled last week. 

Light golden with a 3/4 moon of white foam atop and nice clarity. Smells like pineapple, sweet mangos, pine and a gobs of sweet malts. I like the nose, as I do with most Sauvin beers. Flavor is sweet and bitter with good bits of the character from the olfactory. I like the slight oxidation I get in Alpines beers - nice woodiness. If this was in any other kind of beer, Id be upset, but it is well played here. Medium bodied with sharp, tight carb and a semi dry finish. Nice beer.

Serving type: bottle

09-18-2012
Alpines "Nelson" and "Duet" are my favorite IPAs anywhere.

22 oz. bottle from tleaver33. Pours hazy bright apricot orange with a soft tight soapy white head that fades to a wispy film and soapy collar. Aroma is resinous bitter piny spruce unripe orange spicy citrus white pepper and malt. Taste is bitter spruce pepper pine malt subtle citrus flavors of mainly rind/zest floral some onion and pepper. Palate is medium soft carbonation crisp biting and little alcohol in the finish as well as pepper. Big thanks Tom, been wanting to try this one for some time now!

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2013 This beer poured a delicate and brilliant gold with a faint orange hue when held to the light in the room. When held to natural light it is all golden yellow and with a faint greenish presence. Head is cottony, white, and fell slowly leaving spectacular and decorative lace. 

The nose on this is delicate and floral. Bright citrus zest. Its grassy and has a bit of spicy rye. The malt is almost invisible on the nose except for a light clover honey. It has the scent of grape must on it. A sweet white grape with an earthy musk. As it warms it has a wine like nose that is deep and rich without any real heaviness or sugar on it. Theres a bit of pineapple but its very light. Sunny orange is lightly throughout but nothing you can pinpoint. Its ethereal this nose. 

The taste is stellar. Impeccable clarity in the palate. It has the sweet presence of the white wine grape, with its earth and instead of any acidity this beer offers a hop pungency and a tad bitter. The body of the beer is fantastically light. It is as light as water. The malt is but a breath underneath and you dont smell it or taste it but it has to be there. The rye gives it a bit of spice and a bit of an edge. Then that spice tickles the back of the throat as much as the delicate carbonation and thats how smooth it is. The light orange juicy quality of the fruit gives it a sweetness thats not overplayed to sugar. There is grapefruit but its so delicate as to simply be a mouthwatering pleasure. 

This beer is stellar. Its approach to the palate is lightness and grace. it dares you to taste it its so light and then it hits you with an epic hop character that has every taste and aspect of hops. From grass, to a light  herbal spice, juicy fruits, to a dry white wine like finesse. This finishes lightly dry and with much aplomb. Sublime.  

Thanks Jay ORear.

Bottle in trade from a generous dude. Thanks! Pours a beautifully clear light golden color with big fluffy white two finger head. Massive aromatics coming from this, with grapefruits, sweet honey, flowers, more citrus, some creamy sweet wine like aroma as well. Not like anything I have smelled. Flavor begins with a light sweetness on the tongue, and explodes into raw hops, grassy, grapefruit, honey, melons. A nice bitter pine on the way down. The flavor has a pleasant creamy mouthfeel, with sweet honey and big juicy hops. So light on the palate, with medium high carbonation. Up there with the best of them, especially in the single IPA category.

Great beer. Pours a golden hazy color with a decent head. Poured from the bottle. Right away you can smell the hops. It def takes over. The taste is more of the same. It is the perfect summer beer. Very hoppy and goes down easy. a little citrus and pine. This would be a beer you want to drink on a hot day and you could just crush yourself.
From the bottle. Aroma is piney. Color is golden and a bit cloudy. Taste is light, refreshing, with mild bitterness. Very drinkable.

22oz bottle, thanks to Max for sharing. It was the end part of the bottle, and it had been sitting for a while, but it was still delicious and well-worth it. Bright, hazy golden color. Thin off-white head. Some loose splotches of lace. Bigger body, but very light carbonation at this point. Lightly dry finish. Awesome bright piney citrus lemony lightly grassy hop aroma. Minimal bready malt. Awesome hop flavor to this. Bigger bitter taste, light sweet. Despite having sat for a while, and being flat and warm, this is still surprisingly enjoyable, which is very impressive

A: Golden Straw/Orangish hue, White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Citrus, Resin, Bready

T: Citrus, Resin, White Pepper, Earthy, Bready

M: Well Carbonated, Medium Bodied, Dry Mouth

Overal, a solid IPA with a great taste, good mouth, recommended.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2013 Bottle: thanks, Mike! Murky gold, somewhat orange-ish at the edges; amazingly unfiltered, like light toned apple cider. Little head for an IPA, only a timid, eggshell ring forms. Aroma is wall to wall tropical fruits; pineapple, mango, tangerines, & passion fruit among other tropical notes. Almost has a "juice" vibe to it. Back-end has some nice wet and weedy hops, leafy and lightly bitter. Taste is bursting with the same, great hop-induced tropical fruit notes, the biggest being pineapple and tangerines. The weedy, wet, grassy aspect is more defined on the palate. Very mild onion flavor, but it works surprisingly well. Dry finish, likely from the rye. This beer is delicious and insanely drinkable, even at 7% ABV. World class IPA.

Another bottle thanks to Allen. Bigger head this time, some sticky lacing. Picking up even more tropical notes than before; mango, huge passion fruit, peach, & pineapple. Dripping wet, tropical hoppy goodness. This may be the best IPA Ive ever had.

Poured a dark straw with a white creamy head. Lots of lacing the whole way down the glass.

Smells strongly of tropical fruits mostly pineapple, same as most beers with Nelson hops Ive had.

Taste is about like the smell with loads of tropical fruits hitting you at first. Finishes with a slightly spicy finish due to the rye with medium hop bitterness throughout. Good flavor but seemed to be lacking something I cant quite put my finger on.

Carbonation and body are both about average for the style.

By far the best of the (albeit limited) beers Ive had with this hop. Everything from Alpine is solid.

Bottle. A very nice IPA. Pours a transparent light gold with a nice white head that sticks around. Citrus, white wine and rye on the nose. The Nelson Sauvin hops come through cleanly. Dont pass this one up if youre an IPA fan.
Pours hazy-ish straw. Huge tropical fruit nose. Flavor is mango, moderate rye spice, and subtle grapefruit. Reminiscent of an awesome sauv blanc in a lot of ways. What an absolutely incredible IPA.

22 ounce bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, grass, florals, and pine. Taste is grapefruit, tropical fruits, florals, grass, pine, and malt. Lots of hops. Nice.

Bottle from Larry, nice hazy light orangish golden pour with white head. Aroma of lemon, grapefruit and pineapple. Taste is grapefruit and a bit of the rye comes through that is super nice. Super nice body and killer finish!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle tasted before a Dave Matthews show. Pours golden clear with white head. Grapefruit aroma; taste follows with some rye notes and good malt balance. Medium bodied. Delicious, especially on a hot day.
Pours clear a bit plae golden with a small white head. Very citrucy fruity piny beer with a hop forward finish.

Bottle [22oz] c/o Glouglouburp. Pours a yellow-gold with a large lasting fluffy white head. Some lacing on the glass. Aroma is fruity (citrus and tropical fruit) and grassy first followed by some yeast, light rye, a touch of honey and floral notes. Flavour is quite fruity, with tropical fruit, citrus and more, along with grassy and piney notes, some light honey, yeast, light rye and a nice bitter finish. Medium bodied. Easy to drink and pleasant IPA, well done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft - Bright lemon orange citrus, almost juice like. Cloudy yellow with a bubbly thin head. Lemon, orange and a big grass finish. Almost tastes like a mimosa. Bright and refreshing but not what I look for in an IPA.

Sampled from a 0.65l bottle @ Top Hops (BA) Bottle Share. This is a cloudy kinda golden orange one with a small almost bubbly and sidesticking white head. It has this amazing fresh grassy nose, some traces of yeast and a sweetness that reminds me of frosting on a cake. Lovely aroma! The carbonation level is right below average and it has a soft oily mouthfeel. Nelson yeah, cat piss, grapefruit, citrus and tropical fruits all the way in the taste. Really smooth, quite delicious. Could drink loads of this. 15.06.2013

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2013 Bottle in a trade. This is just an amazing straight up IPA. Pours a golden clear color with a white head. Huge grape fruity hoppy aroma. Some vinous white wine aroma as well. I can smell this all day. The taste is slightly bitter but not overpowering. The feel is thin but on point for a light IPA. The rye is a tad spicy but not too much. Quite impressive.
Amazingly fresh, fruity and bitter with a perfect balance of Rye and hop. Im not sure what Nelson Hop is but holy crap its an amazing IPA. Highly recommended.

On tap at the brewpub early this month. Out of many good beers during 9 days in San Diego, this was probably one of the best. And I think one of the reasons I like it so much is that Nelson gives a much more refined, nuanced, and elegant hop profile than the other flavor-of-the-moment American hops. This has a rich, zesty aroma reminiscent of grapes and citrus peel. The flavor keeps with it and combines a bit of spiciness and a soft, succulent kiwi kind of juiciness with some astringency. Really fantastic IPA.
My favorite beer/IPA hands down. Best consumed fresh via tap or bottle within 30 days of brewing.

Got in a trade with TopsecretWaffle. 22 ounce bottle into tulip glass; no bottle dating, but was traded fresh. Pours moderately hazy bright golden amber color with a 2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big mango, passion-fruit, pineapple, peach, lemon zest, tangerine, floral, grass, light pine, bread, light rye, and floral earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of tropical/citrus hop notes with a fair amount of malt balance; and great strength. Taste of big mango, passion-fruit, peach, pineapple, tangerine, lemon zest, floral, grass, light pine, light honey, bread, light rye, and floral earthiness. Fair amount of floral bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of mango, passion-fruit, peach, pineapple, lemon zest, tangerine, floral, grass, light honey, bread, light rye, and floral earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Incredible balance and complexity of bright tropical/citrus hop notes with light-moderate malt balance; and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a smooth and moderately crisp mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is an incredible IPA! Fantastic balance and complexity of tropical and bright citrus hop flavors with a moderate malt balance; and extremely smooth to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy golden light orange color with a decent frothy off-white head. Aroma is a wonderful fleshy fruit hoppiness with hints of grape. Flavor is quite similar with a heavy fleshy fruit sweetness and a mild bitterness. Very well balanced with a light malt background. Light to medium in body with a lasting fruity sweetness. An absolutely fantastic IPA!

Bottle into a tulip at about 55 degrees. All around fantastic. One of the best beers, let alone IPAs, I've had the pleasure of tasting.

Poured very cloudy. I would call this a fruit IPA and it was awesome. I wish I could have this every day.
My absolute favorite IPA. Poured from a growler. Nose is citrus/pine, which I love. Super clean, hoppy taste. Wish I could have this every day.

Pours a hazy golden orange. Not much of a head for an IPA, settles into a light lacy cap. Aroma of tropical fruit; smells like a stick of juicy fruit gum with a hint of grassiness. Big fruit flavor up front on the palate. Finishes dry with a slight rye aftertaste. Medium bodied and slightly carbonated. Overall, an extremely well crafted IPA and one that ranks right up there with the best of them! Well done, Alpine!

Bottle. Pours a clear caramel color with some spotty head. Citrus, pine, tons of fruit is the aroma and taste. Really a damn good beer.

Yellow gold color out of the bottle with a thin fizzy white head.  Big hoppy nose with citrus rinds and some cat urine, but in a good way.  This is a big hop head beer with barely enough malt to support all the hops.  There is a crap ton of orange peel, tangerine, tropical fruit and a little more cat urine in the flavor.  This beer is all about the hops.

22oz bottle. Read some other reviews so I'm kinda nervous because everyone is saying it pours a clear yellow color, however mine is pouring a murky brownish/gray color with a thin white head. I'm not sure if this batch is infected or what is goin on with this. Anyway aroma is nice. Lots of citrus fruit and some tropical notes as well. Taste is citrus, grapefruit, bready malts, and slightly watered down in the bitterness department.

This brew pours a clear yellow-gold color with a medium thin white head that diminishes steadily. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of dank hops, citrus and malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of citrusy hops, toasted malt and pine. The finish is moderately bitter with a snappy, zesty hops aftertaste. Very good all around.

If youve had Abrasive youll like this one.  It is a little more mellow on the palate than Abrasive but everything else is similar with the color, grapefruit taste and aroma.  Its good and worth a try.
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear yellow pour with a thin white head. Malty and piney aroma with some peppery hops. Malty and peppery flavor with piney and grassy hops through to the finish.
22oz from Lili, thanks! Pours hazy yellow, very nice floral citrus hops. taste is balanced and very bright and hoppy. Awesome Beer!

UPDATED: APR 30, 2015 Bomber ordered from beveragesforlessinc.  Pours a cloudy pale orange color with a very small foamy head that fades quickly.  Aroma is surprisingly faint.  Getting pineapple, oranges, rye, lemons, and mangoes.  Taste is disappointing.  Moderately sweet and only a light bitterness.  Tropical fruit, lemons, and rye is the taste. Pretty disappointing for me, been wanting to try this for a while now.  Re-rate 4/30/15 - Tap at Slows!  Aroma is just awesome. Super dank nelson hops and fruit juice. Grapefruit, pineapple, kiwi, green onion, and pine. Taste ridiculously good. Perfect balance of light sweetness, moderate bitterness, and dank hops. Packed with tropical fruit but also get pine, flowers, white grapes, and citrus. Medium body.  High carbonation but so smooth in the mouthfeel. Adds a little creaminess to the oily hop feel. Incredible IPA. Either I had a bad bottle before or my tastes have drastically changed.

Pours light gold with a soapy white head. Aroma is soap, citrus, pine, And light fruit. Taste follows the nose and has a bit of an odd aftertaste. This beer is a bit too light and I was expecting a bit more.

Bottle pours clear yellow with one finger white head, a little cloudiness at the bottom of the bottle.  Nice citrus and pine aroma.  Clean and crisp citrus taste with piny finish.   I do notice a little rye and malt sweetness. Palate a bit thin.  Very drinkable beer, actually very hoppy but not overbearing.

Clear yellow pour.  My daughter accused me of drinking lemonade and not sharing.  Crisp and hoppy, very west coast more spruce and pine hops than most others.  Slight citriusy.  Medium bitterness but easy drinking.

Bottle. Aroma is pineapple, rye, tangerine, mango, and spice. Appearance is cloudy orange with a thin white head. Good lacing. Taste is spicey rye, tropical fruit, white wine. Medium body, decent carbonation, dry finish. Overall a very good ipa worth seeking out.

Pours a slightly hazy golden color. Very easy drinking, mellow citrus hops. So refreshing and delicious cold. Glad I have another bottle.

Yellow and clear pour from 22oz bottle. Light lemon aroma. Easy drinking smooth beer.  Slight bitterness and mild hops. Good citrus and lemon taste. Like it a lot

22oz bottle in a tulip.  Pours cloudy amber with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of fruity and citrusy hops with a little white wine (as the label says) plus some pale and caramel malts.  Flavor the same, with a really interesting hoppiness from these hops.  Average texture.  A really good IPA, but different from most.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is malt, tropical fruit, peach and light citrus. Flavour is malt, tropical fruit, pineapple, mango, peach, citrus and light grapefruit.

Tap at Alpine. 
Aroma: huge dose of floral hops, dank citrus, crisp light malts, pine, super refreshing. 
Appearance: slightly hazy light yellow pour, white head with average retention, some spotty lacing.
Taste: excellent hop flavors, bold orange and grapefruit,  a bit of pine, wow.  Bitterness is medium, and fades fairly quickly to leave the hop flavors to shine.  Just enough light malts for some balance, hints of cracker, a kiss of malt sweetness gives way to a clean and dry finish.
Palate: light/medium body, medium carbonation,  exceedingly smooth.
Overall: really an amazing IPA, clean, tons of aromatic and flavorful hops, bone dry finish.

This and Duet are my two favorite beers in the world. Alpine has a magic formula that always adds up.  There is legend about this and that but it is all BS. Fireman Pat just has a knack for making good brews.  He runs a small shop, keeps it that way on purpose and the results are magnificent.    Some of the more Hoppy varieties are snapped upon EBay and sent cross country. I am fortunate enough to live 30 miles away and have a couple of growlers that I pack whenever I head to the mountains to camp or just for a hike. I return with fresh Alpine beer.  Get it if you can and drink it fresh.
Bottle shared with friends. Wow! Super fresh and super hoppy. Good balance between hops and malts. Not overly sweet or bitter, but just the perfect balance.
Bottle share at TG on Assassin release day - thanks guys! Slightly hazy golden pour, nice dank nose, lots of citrus hops in the nose and in the beer.

Draft @ the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter finish.

Attractive aroma and medium golden pour with a lite but balanced taste and warming mouthfeel.

M: Dry, medium mouthfeel. Really cuts through the palate. 

O: A very good IPA with an incredible bitterness thats well integrated into the whole. Drink and enjoy; Alpine is doing great work.

shit! as is in really good!! .. . deep gold .. good size head, lacing is a peach .. . lots of citrus, happy sap, and fried hops .. . big hop presensce but not overpowering, very slick and full .. . great ipa!! .. . . i might just close early today!

A very unique IPA.  Those Nelson Sauvin hops are something else.  Very good, but to be honest not as mind-blowing as I was expecting coming in.  The aroma is definitely the strong suit, excellent.

Bottle @ Bandlys Blålys, Odense 2012. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Gasoline, berries and exotic hops. Fruit punch. Dry, hoppy and crisp.

Poured from bottle a orange color with a white head. Nice citrus and pine aroma. Nice smooth creamy taste. I really enjoyed this beer.

Summary: This is a really made IPA, and really I think this is an IPA that both an IPA hop head and an IPA hater could enjoy.

Best IPA around. No fancy gimmicks or tricks, just a solid smell taste and finish. The trip to Alpine for Nelson is worth the journey, and throw in a batch of garlic fries youll swear youve just been raptured!
